Name: Tomato Spider Mites
Description: Tomato spider mites are small arachnids that can infest tomato plants and cause damage by sucking sap from the leaves, causing yellowing, browning, and eventually death of the affected leaves. They are typically most problematic in hot and dry weather conditions.

Treatments.Spray with water: Use a strong stream of water to spray the undersides of the leaves where the mites congregate. This can dislodge and remove a significant portion of the mites.

Treatments.Insecticidal soap: Use an insecticidal soap spray that is labeled for use on tomatoes.

Treatments.Neem oil: Use a neem oil spray that is labeled for use on tomatoes. Neem oil works as both an insecticide and a fungicide, and can help control spider mites as well as other pests and diseases.

Treatments.Miticides: If the infestation is severe, you may need to use a miticide specifically labeled for spider mites on tomatoes.

Products.Pyrethrin: This is a natural insecticide made from chrysanthemum flowers. It is effective in controlling spider mites, but may also harm beneficial insects.

Products.Acaricides: These are chemical insecticides that are specifically designed to control mites. They can be effective in controlling spider mites, but may also harm beneficial insects.
